description: Written promise by executor to pay estate debt
facts: Karen, as executor of her father's estate, signed a written promise to personally pay a $30,000 debt owed by the estate
The writing clearly states Karen's personal liability
The estate has insufficient assets to cover the debt
asp_facts: contract(c6). subject_matter(c6, debt_payment). parties(c6, karen, larry). is_executor_promise(c6, yes). has_writing(c6, yes). is_signed(c6, yes). debt_amount(c6, 30000). personal_liability(c6, yes).
question: Is this promise enforceable under the Statute of Frauds?
rationale: An executor's promise to personally pay estate debts must be in writing under the Statute of Frauds. This promise is in writing and signed, so it satisfies the statute.
